that the subject's beliefs about their

how they viewed their friend's
personality their sense of self changed
the study was conducted by a team of

laboratory led by Henrik our zombie the
researchers wanted to understand the
relationship between one's physical and
psychological sense of self in order to
simulate the effect of two friends
swapping bodies researchers fitted pairs
of friends with goggles that showed a
live first person perspective feed of
their friend's body
researchers then applied simultaneous
touches on subjects corresponding body
parts providing the illusion that they
were really feeling what they saw in the
goggles just a few moments later
participants felt as if they had woken
up in someone else's body according to

Laboratory

uh prop knife that is

but swapping bodies also affected the

the friend's self-perception and beliefs

we found that during the perceptual
friend body swap illusion participants
rated their own personality
characteristics more similar to the way

xiami science this main finding suggests

the research which was published in the

to others
so when someone's mental self-concept
doesn't match their physical self their
memory performance can decrease the
researchers plan to develop the
technique further with hopes to use it

he researches the sense of self for
